backend/main.mo: Main actor implementing a social video platform with user profiles, video uploads (including 'vidles'), follow/unfollow, likes, comments, messaging, and friend request system with access control and blob storage integration.
backend/migration.mo: Migration module that adds a friendRequests map to the actor state while preserving existing data structures for profiles, videos, followers, likes, comments, and messages.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting the implementation of friend system components including React Query hooks, AddFriendsModal, FriendRequestsList, FriendsList, and their integration into MessagingPage.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend files including components (Layout, VideoCard, modals), pages (FeedPage, ProfilePage, MessagingPage), styling (neon-themed CSS), and configuration files.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with OKLCH color system defining light and dark mode CSS variables for background, foreground, primary, secondary, accent, destructive, border, and chart colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with UTF-8 charset, viewport meta tag, 'SkelUlt' title, root div, and module script loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root application component configuring TanStack Router with routes for feed, vidles, profile, video detail, messages, and 404 pages, wrapped in ThemeProvider, QueryClientProvider, ErrorBoundary, and Layout with Toaster.
Modal dialog for searching users by username and sending friend requests. Currently has a limitation where it tracks sent requests by username but needs Principal to actually send requests to the backend.
frontend/src/components/ChatThread.tsx: Displays a chat conversation with a specific user, showing their profile header, message history with auto-scroll, and an option to send friend requests if not already friends.
frontend/src/components/CommentInput.tsx: Form component for posting comments on videos with authentication check, textarea input, and submit button with loading states.
frontend/src/components/CommentSection.t: Displays a scrollable list of video comments with author avatars, usernames, timestamps, and comment text. Shows loading state and empty state when no comments exist.
frontend/src/components/ConversationList: Displays a list of conversation partners with avatars, last message preview, timestamps, and friend badges. Supports selection to open a specific chat thread.
frontend/src/components/EditProfileModal: Modal dialog for editing user profile including username, bio, and profile picture upload with image preview. Handles file validation and profile update submission.
frontend/src/components/ErrorBoundary.ts: React error boundary component that catches rendering errors and displays a fallback UI with error details and a reload button.
frontend/src/components/FollowButton.tsx: A button component that allows users to follow/unfollow other users, with optimistic UI updates, authentication checks, and toast notifications for success/error states.
frontend/src/components/FriendRequestsLi: Displays a list of pending friend requests with accept/decline actions, showing user avatars and usernames fetched from profiles.
frontend/src/components/FriendsList.tsx: Shows a scrollable list of friends with unfriend functionality, including a confirmation dialog before removing a friend.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Main application layout component with sticky header navigation, logo, theme toggle, and conditional rendering of authenticated routes (messages, profile, upload).
frontend/src/components/LikeButton.tsx: A like button for videos with optimistic updates, authentication checks, and prevents duplicate likes with visual feedback.
frontend/src/components/LoginButton.tsx: Handles Internet Identity authentication with login/logout functionality, loading states, and query cache clearing on logout.
frontend/src/components/MessageBubble.ts: Renders individual chat messages with timestamp, optional video link, and different styling for own vs. received messages.
frontend/src/components/MessageInput.tsx: Message composition form with textarea input, video attachment picker, and send functionality for chat conversations.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: Modal dialog for new users to create their profile with username (required) and bio (optional) fields. Submits profile data using useSaveUserProfile mutation and displays loading/error states.
frontend/src/components/ShareButton.tsx: Button component that copies a video's URL to the clipboard when clicked. Displays a share icon and shows toast notifications for success/failure.
frontend/src/components/VideoCard.tsx: Card component displaying video details with thumbnail, uploader info, like/share buttons, and follow/unfollow functionality. Includes delete confirmation dialog for own videos and navigation to video detail page.
frontend/src/components/VideoGrid.tsx: Grid layout component for displaying videos in a responsive 3-column layout. Each grid item shows video thumbnail with play overlay, Vidle badge, and delete button for owned videos.
Modal dialog that displays a user's uploaded videos in a grid for selection. Used for linking videos in comments or other contexts.
frontend/src/components/VideoUploadModal: Modal for uploading videos with title, description, tags, and content type (video/vidle) fields. Validates Vidle uploads for 9:16 aspect ratio and 5s-2:30min duration, shows upload progress, and handles file validation.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance based on authentication state. Invalidates dependent queries when identity changes and initializes access control with admin token.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity storage, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for all backend operations including user profiles, videos, comments, likes, follows, friends, and messaging with mutations and cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with neon-inspired light/dark theme using OKLCH color space, custom utilities for neon glow effects, gradients, and scrollbar styling.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React root with QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider wrappers around the main App component.
frontend/src/pages/FeedPage.tsx: Displays a feed of most-liked videos with loading states, error handling, and triggers profile setup modal for authenticated users without profiles.
frontend/src/pages/MessagingPage.tsx: Messaging interface with tabs for conversations and friends list, displays friend requests with badge count, and includes add friends modal functionality.
frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx: User profile page showing avatar, username, bio, stats, and video grid with edit functionality for own profile and follow button for other users.
frontend/src/pages/VideoDetailPage.tsx: Displays a single video with player, metadata (title, description, tags), uploader profile info, engagement buttons (like/share), and comment section. Includes loading states, error handling, and navigation back to feed.
frontend/src/pages/VidlesPage.tsx: Displays a feed of short-form vertical videos (Vidles) with engagement features, profile setup modal for authenticated users, and empty state prompting first upload. Includes loading/error states and profile integration.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for extracting, storing, and managing URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence and cleanup capabilities.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom color scheme using OKLCH, extended border radii, neon shadow effects, custom animations, and typography/container plugins.
project_state.json: Project metadata for SkelUlt social video platform documenting architecture (multi-platform video hosting, messaging, vidles), existing features (auth, profiles, uploads, engagement), and known issues (white screen, delete button failures).
